title: Thinking about attending the Biden inauguration? You're going to pay a premium
description: Presidential inaugurations can be challenging in even the best conditions. Taking place in late January, the weather in DC is often numbingly cold. Large crowds of people clamoring to get near a stage isn't always fun. And this year, with a surge of Covid-19 cases, requirements for testing, and possible quarantines, will people even come?

title: Covid-19 scare unfolds aboard first Caribbean cruise since the pandemic began
description: A Covid-19 scare is the last thing the cruise industry needs as it eases back into the Caribbean.

title: Trump blew up TikTok and now nobody knows what's going on
description: After narrowly avoiding a ban in the United States earlier this fall, TikTok is again veering toward an imminent crisis with the Trump administration.

title: That 'murder hornet' nest scientists found and destroyed had nearly 200 queens
description: It turns out there were a lot more queens in the first-ever giant Asian "murder hornet" nest found in the US than what they initially discovered.

title: Georgia to conduct full by-hand count of presidential election ballots
description: Georgia's secretary of state announced Wednesday that the state will conduct a full hand recount of the ballots cast in the 2020 presidential race.

title: Jeffrey Toobin fired from The New Yorker after exposing himself on Zoom call
description: Jeffrey Toobin, a prominent writer and CNN's chief legal analyst, was fired from The New Yorker on Wednesday after he accidentally exposed himself to colleagues with the New Yorker and WNYC during a Zoom call last month.

title: President saves century-old fig tree from being cut down for China-funded highway
description: Kenya's President Uhuru Kenyatta has issued a decree to save a much-loved century-old fig tree from being cut down to make way for a Chinese-funded highway in the capital Nairobi.

title: Tropical Storm Eta threatens Florida's Gulf Coast with its fourth landfall
description: Eta strengthened again to a Category 1 hurricane over the Gulf of Mexico on Wednesday morning, and it could soon veer toward Florida bringing heavy downpours and dangerous flash flooding, river flooding and landslides.

title: Jason Momoa was in debt after 'Game of Thrones'
description: According to Jason Momoa he was "completely in debt" and "starving" immediately following his role on the hit series "Game of Thrones."

title: Scientists cautious as Russia says early data shows Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine is 92% effective
description: Russia's sovereign wealth fund said on Wednesday that an early analysis of data from its Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine suggests it is 92% effective. However, some scientists are urging caution, noting that the data is far from conclusive.

title: Trump installs advocate for quick Afghanistan withdrawal at Pentagon
description: An ardent opponent of the US military's presence in Afghanistan who once called for the use of lethal force against illegal immigrants and has made a litany of racist comments has been made a senior adviser at the Pentagon.

title: Hugh Grant: Covid-19 makes you 'want to sniff strangers' armpits'
description: Actor Hugh Grant revealed on "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" that he went on a sniffing frenzy because the illness had depleted his sense of smell.

title: Van Jones: America is in danger right now
description: CNN's Van Jones and Abby Phillip break down the Republican response to the 2020 US election and examine why Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell seems to be siding with President Trump.

title: CNN foreign correspondents explain what a Biden presidency could mean for regions of the world
description: The US Presidential election is much more than a domestic event, with millions across the world watching it unfold every four years. From China to Russia, Europe and Israel, CNN reporters look at the impact Joe Biden's 2020 win could have on countries and people globally.

title: Thousands are fleeing into Sudan to escape deadly conflict in Ethiopia
description: Thousands of Ethiopian civilians have fled into neighboring Sudan to escape escalating conflict in their country's northern region, with many more expected to follow, according to Sudanese officials and the United Nations (UN).

title: The place that created a musical genius
description: He's the towering musical genius who didn't let his deafness prevent him from becoming one of the world's greatest composers.

title: Scores of civilians beheaded by insurgents in Mozambique, witness says
description: Insurgents beheaded scores of people in Mozambique's northernmost province of Cabo Delgado in a series of attacks that began on October 31 and lasted several days, an eyewitness told CNN, confirming earlier state media reports.

title: Trump's efforts to deny the outcome cannot change the reality. Biden won this election and it's not close.
description: President Donald Trump's efforts to deny the outcome of the 2020 election cannot change an undeniable reality: Joe Biden won decisively, and his lead nationally and in key states has grown over time as more votes have been counted.

title: 'It looks like a cartoon': Latest botched art restoration draws ridicule in Spain
description: Move over, "Monkey Jesus." The latest in a series of bizarre art restoration attempts to hit Spain has been spotted in the northern city of Palencia.

title: Cyclist given nine-month suspension after horrific crash
description: Dutch cyclist Dylan Groenewegen has been suspended for nine months following a horrific crash in the Tour of Poland earlier this year.

title: K-Pop band Blackpink's video with giant panda cub sparks outrage in China
description: K-Pop band Blackpink has sparked outrage in China after videos were circulated showing band members handling a giant panda cub in a South Korean zoo.

title: Women's rights activist shot dead in broad daylight
description: Libya's UN-backed Government of National Accord has condemned the killing of prominent Libyan lawyer and women's rights activist Hanan al-Barassi, who was gunned down by armed men Tuesday in the eastern city of Benghazi.

title: China breaks national record for Mariana Trench manned-dive amid race for deep sea resources
description: China has broken its own record for deepest manned dive into the world's oceans, sinking an estimated 10,909 meters (35,790 feet) into the Mariana Trench, state-run news agency Xinhua said.

title: Naked female statue meant to honor feminist icon met with public derision
description: Mary Wollstonecraft, the 18th-century English writer and philosopher often dubbed the "mother of feminism," received a new tribute on Tuesday: a statue in a London park meant to honor her life and work.

title: Honda's new Legend will drive itself on busy roads
description: Honda is launching a new version of its Legend sedan that will take over for drivers on busy highways after the company got approval for its level 3 self-driving system in Japan.

title: This 81-year-old Italian man couldn't visit his wife in hospital, so he serenaded her from the street
description: If music be the food of love, play on -- especially when coronavirus restrictions leave you with little other option.

title: Modi declares victory in India's first coronavirus election
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has claimed victory in the country's first major state election held during the pandemic.

title: He's seen 3 transitions. Hear what he says about Trump
description: Richard Clarke, a top counter-terror adviser to Presidents Bill Clinton and George W. Bush, warns of the potential threats to national security that come with a delayed presidential transition.

title: Forty years on after Seve Ballesteros' magnificent Masters triumph
description: Augusta National is a sporting stage unlike any other.

title: Best foods to try in Poland
description: If Polish cuisine were to be described in just one word, "heartfelt" would perhaps be the most fitting choice.

title: Hong Kong and Singapore confirm date for launch of new 'travel bubble'
description: Hong Kong and Singapore have set a date to launch their new "air travel bubble," which will allow residents to travel between the two Asian hubs without requiring quarantine or restrictive control measures.

title: Lawmaker: This is the 'death knell' for Hong Kong's democracy fight
description: Four pro-democracy lawmakers in Hong Kong were stripped of their seats in the Legislative Council after Beijing passed a resolution giving local authorities broad new powers to quash dissent. The move could signal the end of political opposition in the city. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports.

title: UK is testing an idea to bring normalcy back. But there's a catch
description: The UK government says it's developing population-wide coronavirus testing. Officials are trying out the strategy in Liverpool, England where all residents and workers can now get regular coronavirus tests, regardless of whether or not they display symptoms. CNN's Salma Abdelaziz reports.

title: Internet mocks McDonald's new meatless burger
description: McDonald's McPlant burger gets McMocked. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on poking fun at a meatless patty.

title: Top Pentagon official quits day after Trump fires defense secretary
description: The Pentagon's top policy official, James Anderson, resigned Tuesday, according to two US defense officials, a day after President Donald Trump fired Secretary of Defense Mark Esper.

title: Coronavirus hospitalizations in US reach an all-time high
America's closest allies acknowledge Biden's victory
description: America's closest allies are calling to congratulate President-elect Joe Biden even as President Donald Trump refuses to concede the presidential election.

title: Dr. Sanjay Gupta answers questions on Covid-19 and vaccines
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta joins Anderson Cooper to answer viewer questions about Covid-19. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6pm E.T.
